definition: things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

sentences.english: But the past is, well, it's past.
sentences.chinese: 但是它畢竟會時過境遷。

sentences.english: But this time was different. I knew I did not want the baby.
sentences.chinese: 但時過境遷，我知道這次是我自己不想要這個孩子。

sentences.english: That is the wise way to look at these things when once they are past.
sentences.chinese: 這正是時過境遷看待事物的明智辦法。

sentences.english: After all, when Iturn back, I found you are still the most precious for me.
sentences.chinese: 時過境遷，當我回過身發現你仍然是我最珍惜的人。

sentences.english: Otherwise all we will ever have is a constantly shifting 'pre-contemporary art'.
sentences.chinese: 否則，就是時過境遷的“前當代藝術”。

sentences.english: Mind, passage of time, still ringing in our ears.
sentences.chinese: 物換星移，時過境遷，言猶在耳。

sentences.english: But times had changed, it has become a dust-laden history.
sentences.chinese: 可是時過境遷，那已經成爲塵封的歷史。

sentences.english: The time has passed by, today's artists are no longer aiming to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 時過境遷，當下藝術家並不需要以反抗爲目標。

definition: lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: the people are gone and the place is empty (idiom)/the sight of a deserted place brings old friends to mind/the place is deserted/the birds have flown
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
the ways of the world/social behavior
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
